title: Ticket #5329: Unify user log event writing code
description:
Right now there is a whole bunch of duplicate code for writing user log events. For example, the following source code files all have InitializeUserLog() or similarly-named functions that look like they pretty much all do the same thing:
  • condor_gridmanager/basejob.cpp
  • condor_job_router/submit_job.cpp
  • condor_schedd.V6/schedd.cpp
  • condor_shadow.std/log_events.cpp
  • condor_shadow.V6.1/baseshadow.cpp
  • condor_starter.V6.1/local_user_log.cpp

I guess one question is whether we want to do anything with this that's short of moving the event writing into its own daemon (#963). But maybe we could consolidate things into a single class that would be used by all of the above code as step 1, and then move that into a separate daemon as step 2?

Anyhow, I just wanted to record that there is an awful lot of duplicate (or near-duplicate) code related event writing...
remarks:
2019-Dec-02 16:10:00 by jfrey:
No user-visible changes, so no version history.

2019-Dec-02 16:32:13 by jfrey:
The code for initializing a WriteUserLog object has been consolidated into two initialize() methods in WriteUserLog:
  • Specify a single log file, job id, and format parameters. No privilege switching.
  • Specify a job ad, which is used to determine all destination files and formatting. Privilege switching done as appropriate. Option to init/uninit user account to switch to.

More simplification to consider for the future:

  • Turn vector of log files into two explicit files (user-specified log and dagman log).
  • Optimize common case for DAGManNodesMask or remove checking of it entirely (i.e. hard-code list of DAGMan-relevant event types).
